timeline.message: Refactor: Move other 2 classes to file package
Refactor: Rename fields and methods, return early

Remove awaitTermination
Remove UserThread.execute on shutdown
Rename threadname
Refactor: use FileUtil.removeAndBackupFile instead of FileManager.removeAndBackupFile
Remove Storage and FileManager from logback

Add PersistenceManager.flushAllDataToDisk to shutdown to write all pending data to disk
Use new readAllPersisted method instead of setupPersistedDataHosts. Run read tasks in a thread in parallel.

Read is only done at startup.

Remove unused restart method
Use PersistenceManager instead of Storage for import/export

Remove UserThreadMappedPersistableList and use PersistableList instead

We will not need threading support anymore once we use the new persistenceManager as serialisation is done on the userThread.

Remove UserThreadMappedPersistableEnvelope and use PersistableEnvelope instead

We will not need threading support anymore once we use the new persistenceManager as serialisation is done on the userThread.

Remove ThreadedPersistableEnvelope and use PersistableEnvelope instead

We will not need threading support anymore once we use the new persistenceManager as serialisation is done on the userThread.
Use PersistenceManager for StoreService (not yet supported for subclasses)
Use PersistenceManager for MapStoreService (not yet supported for subclasses)

Update ProtectedDataStoreService
Use AtomicReference instead of array, add final

Add final at ResourceDataStoreService
Remove clone from SequenceNumberMap.
Apply generics and super class methods

Remove lombok Delegate from PersistableList
Add final
Add setAll method
Remove Iterable interface
Refactor: Move classes to new package

Remove storage from dispute. We do persistence from outside now.
Impl. PersistablePayload
Make openingDate final and contr param
Remove storage and persist calls. Remove unused methods
Use PersistenceManager. We do not persist inside openOffer anymore but from outside
Remove unused fields, apply new params
Remove FileManager ans Storage. All is replaces not by PersistenceManager
Add missing persist calls. Add generics. Remove persist method. Add final.
Remove unneeded param. Add requestPersistence calls. Cleanup removeTrade and addTrade methods

Fix remaining issues, cleanups, add persit calls, remove unused code,...

Sorry too tired to create another 20 commits...
Cleanups, add generics, add final, remove unused code/comments/todos,
Revert exit code to 1 as it was before. Not sure if there have been some scripts for seeds which expect an error code at shutdown for auto restart. I remotely remember there have been something...
Rename getClosedTradables and getFailedTrades to getObservableList
Remove duplicate startApplication call. Remove checkCryptoSetup call and fields used only for that.

Rename writeCompleted to onWriteCompleted
Add comment
Use decrementAndGet instead of getAndDecrement

Tested cases when there is an exception at write to disk, but as we call the result handler in the finally clause we get always called onWriteCompleted, so it cannot happen that we get stuck.

Persist all Priority.HIGH stores at shutdown to be more safe that we did not miss any state update.
Priority.HIGH stores are all those which contain private data. Others can be rebuilt from network data or are not critical like navigationPath.

Enforce that clients set the priority. Remove the initialize methods which did not have priority as a param.
Make initializePersistenceManager in StorageService abstract to enforce in concrete class to define priority.

Change priorities for future renaming to a different meaning. instead of priority we want to describe the category: private data, public data,.... will come in next commit

Rename Priority to Source. This should make it more clear what is the intention of the usage.

Rename:
LOW to NETWORK
MID to PRIVATE_LOW_PRIO
HIGH to PRIVATE

Change delay of MID/PRIVATE_LOW_PRIO from 30 min to 2 hours (we had different datastores before using it, now its only real low prio stores)

Add comment to each enum

timeline.author: sqrrm
sqrrm

timeline.bodyText: Why use runPeriodically() instead of runAfter()? The effect would be the same but now it seems the write is intended to happen periodically, but two lines later that we see that it's not.
timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: Yes was from earlier version, should be runAfter.
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.bodyText: This does not look safe. I think list should be an ObservableList since it's required by this interface. It's first initiated to an ArrayList (line 39) but I assume all implementations of PersistableList passes an ObservableList as the constructor argument.
timeline.author: sqrrm

replies.bodyText: Yes, was moving the listeners later to the base class. But I think best here is to enforce observeable list as it is used anyway by all subclasses.
replies.author: chimp1984

replies.bodyText: After looking at subclasses its not true. many dont use ObservableList. I will move back the ObservableList methods to the classes which actually use them and remove all ObservableList casts from the base class
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.bodyText: Naming the generic tradable is confusing, item is more neutral
timeline.author: sqrrm

timeline.bodyText: Rather use a uniform naming for the generic, like item
timeline.author: sqrrm
sqrrm

replies.bodyText: Will fix in a new commit with other changes...
replies.author: chimp1984

timeline.message:
Add PersistableListAsObservable
Remove ObservableList methods from PersistableList
Let DisputeList and TradableList extend PersistableListAsObservable
Fix param names

Do not use persistNow for snapshots but requestPersistence

This avoids frequent write at dao sync and better performance.

timeline.author: sqrrm
sqrrm

+package bisq.common.proto.persistable;
+
+import javafx.collections.FXCollections;
+import javafx.collections.ListChangeListener;
+import javafx.collections.ObservableList;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+public abstract class PersistableListAsObservable<T extends PersistablePayload> extends PersistableList<T> {
+
+    public PersistableListAsObservable() {
+    }
+
+    protected PersistableListAsObservable(List<T> list) {

replies.bodyText: No, that is called from protobug methods and there we map to a list, will be copied over to the observable in the base class. We could use a collection here as well to make it more clear that its not setting the list.
replies.author: chimp1984

replies.bodyText: Right you are, since the list is created by createList(). No need to change, this is correct.
replies.author: sqrrm

timeline.message:
Use Collection for constructor which is called from the fromProto methods.
We do not set the collection as list but we fill the list created via the createList method.
